sentences.sContent: Newspapers have been fulsome in their praise of the former president.
sentences.sCn: 报界对前任总统的赞扬过于恭维了。

remMethod.val: ful(l)(满) + some(带有…的) → 充足的

trans.tranCn: 过度的, 令人生厌的, 过分的
trans.tranOther: If you describe expressions of praise, apology, or gratitude as fulsome, you disapprove of them because they are exaggerated and elaborate, so that they sound insincere
